pretty good card. Does a ton of damage for a price thats not to hard to afford on a very energy efficient character like hexaghost; massively scales with intensity as well and gives you an extra turn with doomsday really easily

it needs an upgrade a lot of the time, but hexaghosts upgrades across the board tend to be just average so its not a huge cost; plus with 5th seal you can upgrade your whole deck by act 4. Obligatory snecko eye mention.

You usually don't need this on hexaghost, but it is fun. If your deck wants a closer style card (magnum, fiend fire, gem cannon, blasphemy) this does a pretty solid impression of that, though it is more expensive than those other options (admittedly for other characters), really needs an upgrade to be more playable, and really needs to be paired with intensity to shine. Becomes far more playable if you have a copy of radiant flames to generate lots of block with it, and lets you automatically proc doomsday and have an even stronger burst by extending the turn.

I find that hexaghost rarely needs to play this sort of card, you are already good at short and medium length fights due to afterlife, so having a really bursty option to close fights fast isn't that valuable. Most commonly, I would take it if I felt that I needed a way to end boss fights, and had a lot of intensity scaling. Waiting to play this until you have 5+ intensity on your second or third cycle through the deck to deal 100+ damage in one go can be valuable, especially against neow. The cost is also not as big of a drawback as it looks, 5th seal is excellent at upgrading your deck, and afterlife often means that you can afford to spend most/all of your turn paying for this type of card and still get additional output. Great with snecko eye of course, and you can use it with runic pyramid to line it up as a finisher more effectively or to double ignite the inferno ghostflame with it.
